le":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"inputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"constructor"},{"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"fallback"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"who","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"Withdraws","type":"event"},{"anonymous":false,"inputs":[{"indexed":true,"name":"who","type":"address"},{"indexed":false,"name":"amount","type":"uint256"}],"name":"Deposit","type":"event"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{}},"userdoc":{"methods":{"_withdrawTo(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Business logic of _withdrawTo, the code is separated this way mainly for\r testing. We can inject and test parameters freely without worrying about the\r blockchain model.\r \t * NOTE: Since function is constant, no guards are applied. This function will give\r invalid outputs unless in postStart state. It is up to user to manually check\r that the correct state is given (isStart() == true)\r"},"availableForWithdrawalAt(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the fraction of total (one-off + monthly) withdrawable\r given the current timestamp. No guards due to function being constant.\r Will output invalid data until the postStart state. It is up to the user\r to manually confirm contract is in postStart state.\r"},"init(uint256)":{"notice":"Initialization function, should be called after contract deployment. The\r addition of this function allows contract compilation to be simplified\r to one contract, instead of two.\r \t * periods and t0special are finalized, and effectively invariant, after\r init is called for the first time.\r"},"isStarted()":{"notice":"Check withdrawal is live, useful for checking whether\r the savings contract is \"live\", withdrawal enabled, started.\r"},"lock()":{"notice":"Lock is called by the owner to lock the savings contract\r so that no more deposits may be made.\r"},"nullify()":{"notice":"Nullify functionality is intended to disable the contract.\r"},"periodAt(uint256)":{"notice":"Calculates the monthly period, starting after the startBlockTimestamp,\r periodAt will return 0 for all timestamps before startBlockTimestamp.\r \t * Therefore period 0 is the range of time in which we have called start(),\r but have not yet passed startBlockTimestamp. Period 1 is the\r first monthly period, and so-forth all the way until the last\r period == periods.\r \t * NOTE: not guarded since no state modifications are made. However,\r it will return invalid data before the postStart state. It is\r up to the user to manually check that the contract is in\r postStart state.\r"},"sendTokens(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Used to refund users who accidentaly transferred tokens to this\r contract, only available before contract is locked\r"},"start(uint256)":{"notice":"Starts the distribution of savings, it should be called\r after lock(), once all of the bonus tokens are send to this contract,\r and multiMint has been called.\r"},"withdrawTo(address)":{"notice":"Public facing withdrawTo, injects business logic with\r the correct model.\r"}}}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"Savings.sol":"Savings"},"libraries":{},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":200},"remappings":[]},"sources":{"Savings.sol":{"keccak256":"0xbb9dab7b48f9752777dd129992b39febd18f23493f216d7d50c8f9a418c08b23","urls":["bzzr://9da9d75284b35a25fffa97349608704e1170d98662a4e0c393cac1809884543a"]}},"version":1}
